meanings.definition: To control or restrain with a bridle.
meanings.sent1: She was bridling her excitement before the big surprise party.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to remind the students to stop bridling their laughter during the serious presentation.
meanings.sent3: The cat was bridling its curiosity, trying not to pounce on the moving toy.
meanings.sent4: His determination was like a tightly bridled horse, ready to charge forward at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The child was bridling his impatience, waiting eagerly for his turn to open the gift.

meanings.sent1: He was bridling at the unfair criticism he received.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help bridling when her brother teased her about losing the game.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was bridling playfully, pretending to be upset when its toy was taken away.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like a stormy sea, bridling with unspoken frustration.
meanings.sent5: The customer was bridling with impatience as he waited for his order.

meanings.definition: The act of putting a bridle on a horse.
meanings.sent1: The bridling of the horse was done gently and skillfully by the experienced stable hand.
meanings.sent2: During the competition, the quick bridling of the horses impressed the judges.
meanings.sent3: The comical bridling of the pony made the children giggle uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The bridling of the majestic stallion symbolized the beginning of the royal procession.
meanings.sent5: The intricate bridling of the horse was a beautiful sight to behold.
